sub_topic: Prove that the power set of a set is always larger than the set itself.
message_1: If a set S has 4 elements, what is the size of its power set in terms of cardinality?
message_2: The size of the power set of a set with n elements is given by 2^n. In this case, since the set S has 4 elements, the size of its power set in terms of cardinality is 2^4, which is equal to 16.
